attributes.action: People convicted of Drink driving should be disqualified for life.
attributes.background: Too many people previously convicted return to the road to commit the same offence putting other road users and pedestrians lives at risk.

attributes.action: The Prime Minister, to chair a COBRA meeting to resolve the NHS crisis
attributes.background:
Unnecessary deaths are occurring because of the crisis engulfing the NHS.

The Prime Minister needs to declare the current crisis an emergency and look at ways of saving lives.

A COBRA meeting should be called and the Prime Minister needs to act now to respond to this current situation.

attributes.action: Allow those 18+ with ID to buy alcohol with someone under 18 present.
attributes.background: I went shopping for Christmas with a friend, wanted to buy a bottle of Baileys for the father in law, I'm 18 and my friend is 17, they would not let me have it because she did not have ID. If you're 18 you should get served. Under 18s will find a way to get alcohol no matter what anyway.
attributes.additional_details: Also, many mothers have been declined to buy alcohol for themselves because they're with their children who are not 18. Are mothers expected to abandon their children now so they can buy a bottle of wine? No.

attributes.action: Include HGV training to the Government backed 24+ Advanced Learning Loans.
attributes.background: To expand the 24+ advanced learning government backed loan to cover HGV license acquisition. There is currently a shortage of 45-50,000 drivers in the UK. Other industries are benefiting from the loan but not an industry that can create 50,000 jobs & whereby the loan could be paid back quickly.
attributes.additional_details:
Driver shortage- http://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/oct/25/lorry-driver-shortage-christmas-deliveries-road-haulage-association

Courses covered: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/advanced-learner-loans-qualifications-catalogue

Ave pay for Class 1 (HGV 1) Driver £28,362 PA 
http://www.totaljobs.com/salary-checker/average-class-1-driver-salary

attributes.action: Change nhs policy that baby born before 24 weeks can intervene with life support
attributes.background: Babies born before 24 weeks in an NHS hospital should be given immediate emergency care to try get babies breathing if born not breathing or need the support when first born

attributes.action: Make every individual who claims job seekers take a drug test before claiming.
attributes.background: This is to stop individuals who claim job seekers claiming whilst containing illegal drugs in their systems. Every job seekers claimant should be free from illegal drugs and it should be a legal requirement to prove this before given their money.

attributes.action: Give the police a return deadline when an item has been seized.
attributes.background: Give the police a 2 month deadline from the date of arrest, once they have seized any item for any form of forensic analysis. After 2 months, they MUST give the property back to the suspect (unless the item has evidence on convicting them of a crime).
attributes.additional_details: A while back, I was (falsely) arrested in a case where the police seized my business laptop, after nearly a year and hundreds of phone calls to the police, my laptop was finally returned to me, and the case was dropped, however, my company had to shut down due to all my work being on that laptop, and I lost a very good company and people lost their jobs. This is all because the police could not "fit my job in" due to more important work in front of me, and never once kept me in the loop.

attributes.action: Build more houses specifically for disabled people who own a blue disabled badge
attributes.background: it will help the disabled people move around their house freely and not rely on other people and in the long run it would be cheaper for all the councils within the UK because they don't have to keep changing the adaptions that's already been done in council houses that need to be updated.

attributes.action: Make driving lessons a part of the education system for 16-18 year olds
attributes.background: making driving a part of the education system could potentially lower the amount of car accidents on the roads involving young people. many people have an accident in their first year of driving, teaching young people about the dangers of driving at a younger age could prevent this.

attributes.action: Raise the minimum wage to £7 a hour for under 18 year olds.
attributes.background: Most work places expect under 18 year olds to work for long amount of hours for hardly any money as the minimum wage is too low. Ensure a minimum of £7 a hour for under 18 year olds.

attributes.action: Make the Government cut V.A.T on "ethical" products.
attributes.background: We the undersigned are demanding that the government promise that once we have left the EU and have control over a V.A.T, products which can be considered "ethical" shall have a V.A.T cut in order to make them more affordable for people and families in the U.K.
attributes.additional_details:
They could be products which:

- in their production cause no harm to the environments they are produced in, 
- no harm is caused to any animals which are part of the products production, 
- all parties who help create the product are paid a fair and decent amount in return for their work.

Examples of products like these would be free-range eggs or FairTrade products.
With this, the general public will be more inclined to buy these, as they will be more affordable.

attributes.action: Introduce 24 hour GP Surgeries throughout the UK to alleviate pressure on A&E
attributes.background: Going back thirty years ago we could call our GP practice and a GP would make a home visit resulting in far fewer unnecessary hospital visits to A&E. Today we have 111 which has increased the number of unnecessary A&E visits. Surely funding the return of night time GP's would be more productive.

attributes.action: Remove political parties from UK Government Procedures
attributes.background: The people of the UK call upon the current UK Government to offer to form a cross-party coalition Government, and then to change the law to require all MPs to resign from their respective political parties. The Government should then set up regional groups of independent MPs to replace the parties.
attributes.additional_details: With no political parties, UK decisions would be made on the basis of geographical consensus, with MPs working in perhaps 12 Regional Groups at Westminster and taking their individual policy mandate from their own local councillors within their individual Constituency.

attributes.action: Make Laser Eye Surgery available as a free NHS service for all eye conditions.
attributes.background: For those people who where glasses and those who do not, as a 20 year old, I struggle with the prospect of knowing that I will have to see the greatest years and future years of my life behind glass, as I am unable to afford the treatment myself.
attributes.additional_details:
Laser eye surgery is available on the NHS for eye conditions that, without treatment, can lead to loss of vision. However, it’s not available for conditions that can be treated successfully in other ways, such as refractive (focusing) errors. 

The reasons for this are that the effect is life changing for the person receiving the treatment. The current means of correcting refractive errors, glasses, are not for everyone.

attributes.action: Lower the legal drinking age to 17
attributes.background: Lowering the legal drinking age could reduce & tackle the problem of binge drinking in the UK - as well as help young people socially as young school leavers can find it difficult to find friends of a similar age in the workplace.
attributes.additional_details: There are multiple reasons for this action to be taken. One reason being that lowering the legal drinking age could prevent people binge drinking when they finally reach 18 years, for example, like a child who's only been allowed fruit & vegetables being let loose at a party full of sweets. In other countries such as France, Germany & Belgium, the legal drinking age is 16 - although a restriction is kept on spirits until 18. I feel that the UK should be keeping up with other countries.

attributes.action: Calling on the Government to pay for basic Child Funerals if their age is 0-11.
attributes.background: Losing a child or baby is devastating. Many parents should not have to have the worry of paying for a funeral at this distressing time. Most do not have the funds to do so. We are calling on the Government to fund basic funerals for bereaved parents if the child they lose is between 0 and 11.

attributes.action: Drivers of vehicles found driving without all four lights fully lit to be fined.
attributes.background: A Significant amount of vehicles are seen to be driving during evening and night hours without all four lights operating.This is a serious safety hazard, particularly on unlit roads and highways.
attributes.additional_details:
Driving during the nighttime is statistically more dangerous than by   daytime.
 Far too many lights burn out or dim between MOT tests, causing potential for serious accidents.

I ask the Government to give greater police powers in In this issue including issuing Penalty Notice and Penalty Points. 

I am convinced that these changes will make are roads even safer.

attributes.action: UK Government should provide incentives to foreign startups and small companies.
attributes.background: All foreign companies  contributes  a lot  UK economy, employment by paying taxes and creating jobs.  Government  has to amend Foreign Direct Investment policy to increase investments .This can be interest free loans or  discount in VAT or Taxes.Recognise them as 'MAKE IN UK' companies.
attributes.additional_details: Due to Brexit effect all foreign companies  are in big ambiguity whether to stay in UK or NOT.Especially startup companies,budding  entrepreneurs and small scale companies are mostly effected.Fear of upcoming changes in trading law  may discourage  their plans and ventures in UK. It’s going to effect largely to the future UK economy and the growth. UK Government should encourage them.

attributes.action: Clocks should be advanced one hour forward in winter instead of summer.
attributes.background: British Summer Time (BST) has been implemented since early 1900s. However, there is little benefit that can be gained. If instead of BST, we turn the clocks one hour forward in winter, we can benefit a lot from it. Particularly in those months when we need daylight i.e. October - February
attributes.additional_details:
An introduction of British Winter Time (BWT) as an alternative to BST would be helpful in winter such that: 

1. Decent daylight would be around 07:00 which is usually the time people are leaving for work. 
2. Sunset will be at approximately 16:30 instead of 15:30 nowadays. We can have more of daylight. 

We already have too much daylight in summer and sunset during summer is at a time when people are going to sleep. Decreasing one hour from both sunrise and sunset wouldn't make much difference.

attributes.action: Cancel the Sugar Tax
attributes.background: The government is introducing the Sugar Tax a.k.a the Soft Drinks Industry Levy in 2018 and this means that soft drinks will either lose some of their good taste due to lower sugar levels or become more expensive as a result of the drink companies passing on the cost of the tax to their customers.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that this tax is an assault on freedom of choice and another example of a nanny state and I call upon the government and parliament to stop its implementation.

attributes.action: Introduce CPR and Basic First Aid to the driving test
attributes.background: CPR as well as basic first aid should be a requirement to pass a uk driving test as driving can be a dangerous thing and you never know when you may need to use those skills, which in turn could potentially save someones life

attributes.action: Support a Unilateral Declaration of Independence for the Kurdistan Region
attributes.background:
In order to maintain peace and stability, it is in the vital interest of the west and neighbours to allow the formal process. 

The KRG leadership has declared the need for an imminent referendum; and the region  has proved to be a partner in trade, the fight against terrorism, and peace for all.

attributes.action: Censor the broadcast of sexually explicit music to protect young children
attributes.background: I am petitioning the British Government to consider censoring the broadcast of sexually explicit music during the day to protect young listeners / viewers.
attributes.additional_details:
I've heard young children singing along to lyrics which are highly sexually suggestive. 

Over the last decade music has become increasingly sexualised and continues to evade existing censorship legislation / regulation.

attributes.action: Treat all purchases of drones in the same way as firearms
attributes.background:
DRONES are a serious threat to our security 
DRONES currently drop packages into our prisons.
DRONES were the cause of 23 near misses April-October 2015
DRONES hover over private homes, schools and parks
attributes.additional_details:
A former RAF and British Airways pilot warned that a drone hitting an airliner could result in an uncontrolled engine failure or a smashed cockpit windscreen.

A flight safety specialist insisted the large amount of data available is not a true representation of what would happen with a drone because "birds don't have a big lump of lithium battery in them".

The UK Airprox Board (UKAB) has published reports on the incidents, which took place between April 11 and October 4 last year.

attributes.action: Oblige all licensed premises to accept Pass Cards as ID and proof of age
attributes.background: Some premises allow Pass Cards to be used as ID, but some pubs and clubs don't allow them and claim they are fake. It is a legit form of identification. Every licensed premise that requires some form of ID to enter should allow Pass Cards just as it allows passports and driving licenses.
attributes.additional_details:
For example I went to a pub with a few friends for a birthday, the bouncer asked where I got it from. I said it’s from the challenge 25 website which has multiple different pass cards and it is a legitimate form of ID. He said nope that is fake, I can get that from ebay or somewhere else online. 

For more information see: http://www.pass-scheme.org.uk/

attributes.action: Give parents the power to decide what their child drinks at school.
attributes.background: My son, 9 years old is autistic and also suffers from OCD and Tourettes, he has always disliked anything without a strong taste, you can imagine the task of getting him to drink water or milk, he has suffered through so many bouts of dehydration at school and many headaches. I want to change this.
attributes.additional_details: I know and have read so many parents stories of how their child/children don't like the taste of water and we can't change our children's taste buds can we? Yes water and milk is a far healthier option no one disagrees but is dehydrating the students risking more damage to their growing bodies. Why can the teachers drink as much tea and coffee fizzy and whatever they fancy whilst the children must only have water, as their parents should it not be our choice to prevent illness and dehydration.

attributes.action: Introduce compulsory attendance to a 'Safe Drive Stay Alive' event
attributes.background: This event is used as means of reducing the amount of accidents and road collisions. It is vital that people are aware of the minor things that can significantly impact their lives, and the lives of others. I believe it should be made mandatory before a person can officially gain their licence.
attributes.additional_details:
'Stay Drive Stay Alive' found that young drivers are much more likely to be involved in a crash on the roads, often due to inexperience and a lack of knowledge of the risks. 
*Around 1 in 4 deaths on the road is aged 17-24*
The Safe Drive Stay Alive campaign will reach new and pre-drivers in an emotive and hard-hitting way, influencing behaviour and attitude on the roads.

attributes.action: Include Aesthetic Impairment or "Ugliness" in The Equality Act 2010.
attributes.background: We call for “Aesthetic Impairment” to be added to The Equality Act (2010) by the UK government and for suffers to be awarded the same protection from discrimination as the other included groups.
attributes.additional_details:
Many people whom are aesthetically Impaired or “ugly” face discrimination and disadvantage on a daily basis. Many unattractive people can be left feeling ostracised and questioning their self-worth and it can also lead to the development of mental health issues. 

Whatever the nature or route cause of someone’s appearance, not everybody can conform with the image of what our society deems to be “attractive” and to judge someone based upon this is fundamentally wrong.

attributes.action: Make landlords & agents give 24 hours notice to access shared rental housing.
attributes.background: I currently live in a share house where the agency accesses the home unannounced. Because my housemates and I complained, the agency tried to threaten me and we feel like we can't enjoy this new home because the laws regarding 24 hours notice to rentals don't include share houses, but they should.
attributes.additional_details: On citizensadvice.org.uk, it's states that landlords "...should always ask for your permission and should give you at least 24 hours notice." However, if you stay in lodgings where the landlord provides a room-cleaning service or where you share a room with other lodgers, your landlord can enter without permission. All my housemates and I have either had our items tampered with in communal areas or our rooms accessed without permission or without due notice. These exceptions should be illegal.

attributes.action: Make the 6 week holidays shorter by spreading the weeks throughout the year.
attributes.background: The 6 week holidays are far too long and children get sluggish at the start of the new term. School grades and attitudes towards school should improve as more time learning.

attributes.action: Make a legal requirement for realistic road crash simulations of child car seats
attributes.background: Having done countless hours of research on car seats, I purchased a Nuna Rebl for my son based on positive reviews. However, it has now been listed as a dangerous car seat, yet meets the UN ECE R129 standards. Worryingly, these standards are extremely poor, and not representative of actual crashes.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently UN UCE R129 standards require seats to perform well in the following, totally unrealistic, crash simulations: 
Front impact: 31 mph
Rear impact: 18.6 mph
Side impact: 14.9 mph
These of course are not representative of many car accidents. If you hit another car head on, both driving at 20mph (a lower speed limit than in most residential areas), there will be a 40mph impact, which isn't covered by the existing required testing, putting children's lives at risk.

attributes.action: A referendum to change our system of electing a representative
attributes.background: A call for a referendum to change our system of electing a representative with 3 options either keep our current system which is First past the post or change to either Alternative vote or the Single transferable vote to ensure a more representative Parliment/Democracy.

attributes.action: Restrict private parking charges to reasonable amounts.
attributes.background: It is proposed that the government amend the Protection of Freedom Act 2014 to restrict the amount a private company can issue a parking charge to a fair and reasonable amount and no more than what the local council can issue a penalty notice.
attributes.additional_details:
Every day many parking charge notices are issued to vehicles parking on private land. Normally, the fee to cover the car is a reasonable nominal amount. However, for those that overstay the period the vehicle is covered or parking the car without any cover the charges are unreasonable and far more than the loss of business the proprietor suffers. 

The everyday person in the United Kingdom that uses parking facilities lawfully but from time to time cannot cover their car for entirely adequate reasons are suffering unreasonable financial burdens.

attributes.action: Have one NHS distribution centre and buying in bulk whilst making cheaper deals.
attributes.background: We need to have one NHS distribution centre sending all the medical equipment and medicines to each individual hospital. Buying in bulk,getting better and more controled deals. Stoping different hospitals paying different prices,hopefully saving millions. The NHS deserves a better deal,and so do we!

attributes.action: Stop forcing English Standard on Young Deaf children
attributes.background: Make English more accessible for Deaf People (e.g. for us not to be forced to achieve English at C grade standard) each classes should have specialist tutor (e.g. Teacher of Deaf and being taught in small groups) Deaf people should not being stopped progressing from achieving a C grade or above
attributes.additional_details: English is our second language, as we find English so hard to understand! which is why we use Sign Language which has a different structure and no written language. We need to stop feeling like we are being forced to learn English at C grade Standard and it is important that we taught English in a way that is accessible to us.

attributes.action: Provide Education Staff with Statutory guidance in the use of force in Schools.
attributes.background: In the UK there is no Statutory Guidance for the use of force for Education staff to ensure their Safety. The Guidance published by the Department of Education is non Statutory, this is placing education staff in dangerous situations as they are unsure what action they can take to protect themselves
attributes.additional_details: Under the Health and Safety act 2005 section 8, "Every employer shall ensure, so far as is reasonably practicable, the safety, health and welfare at work of his or her employees." It is officially recognised by the HSE that the Education sector is a occupation that comes into contact with violence in the workplace. They have published guidance in the measures to be taken to reduce this. DofE guidance is not statutory and this means staff are being put at risk as they are unsure what to do

attributes.action: Change the funding for preschool so that all children start at age 3.
attributes.background: It is unfair that children who are born at the "wrong time"  miss out on schooling. Children who are born after term start dates have to wait till the next term to start school, meaning that a child who was born just before the term will benefit from funding while a child born after misses out.
attributes.additional_details: It should be that all children should get funding when they turn 3, regardless of term dates.

attributes.action: Save Kingfisher Ward and Scbu at Dorchester County Hospital!!
attributes.background: The facilities for the care of very small babies and children are due to be cut drastically. This will involve having to travel at least an hour to get the medical care needed. This is just quite frankly ridiculous!! Time in an emergency is one of the key factors in the best chances of survival.

attributes.action: Hold a general election under MMP
attributes.background: In the 2015 general election The conservative party got just 37 percent of the vote however they got a majority in the house of commons undermining the very ideas of democracy.
attributes.additional_details: The UK currently uses first pass the post which goes horribly with the UK's system of electing M.Ps creating a system which people can't vote for there preferred party and punishes those who do.MMP is a system that allows you to vote both for a local representative whilst allows you to vote for your favourable political party making it the best system for the country.if Britain claims to be a democracy it must act like one.

attributes.action: To Exempt Final Year Uni students From Council Tax, For Their Entire Tenancy.
attributes.background: The government demand that final year Uni students pay council tax for the period between the conclusion of final term right up until the end of your tenancy. This is regardless of the length of your contract (often demanded by landlords to be 11 months) and the fact that you signed it as a student.
attributes.additional_details: My housemates and I feel we were not sufficiently warned or provided any clear statements to make us aware of this law and feel that either this approach must be changed, or that the demand for council tax over these outlying months, be removed completely. We want to help raise awareness for other students so that they don't get caught out too. As graduates we don't earn too much straight after University and to be suddenly hit with a bill that we were unaware of is quite stressful.

attributes.action: raise issue of election with the Zimbabwean gov &/or the international community
attributes.background: Asking the UK government to help raise the issue about re election in Zimbabwe because there needs to be a strong change in order to reduce poverty, lower unemployment rates, pay civil servants and better the health care

attributes.action: Make the buying age of tobacco products 16+.
attributes.background:
The minimum age was 16 years of prior to 1994. 
Plus we can smoke at 16 but not buy it? this makes no sense and needs to be changed asap.

attributes.action: Raise UK Legal Limit of Stakes For Poker In Pubs To £10 & £20 In Members Clubs
attributes.background:
The gambling act 2005 states: 
Low stakes poker is permitted in pubs, with stakes kept to a maximum of £5 per player, with a £100 max pot per premises per day. 
Low stakes poker in social clubs, with the correct permit, allows a maximum of £10 per player £250 total pot per premises per day
attributes.additional_details:
We're petitioning to change this law to the following:
Low stakes poker to be permitted in pubs with stakes kept to: £10 Maximum per player with no maximum pot, in social clubs: £20 maximum per player no maximum pot (modify the gaming permit licence)
stake limits should now be raised as inflation no longer reflects the outdated limits set in the gambling act 2005 & an unrestricted maximum pot size
We believe that this change to the law would also benefit all UK pubs who are struggling to survive

attributes.action: £500 tax allowance,every 4 yrs for sport for either membership fee or equipment.
attributes.background: To capitalize on the excitement of the Olympics, every 4 yrs a £500 tax free allowance per person could be allocated to spend on  either sports membership (golf for an example) or sport equipment. This will prevent certain sports being only available to the well off.

attributes.action: Introduce a Mandatory 10 year prison sentence for Vehicle theft/ involvement in.
attributes.background: The people of Great Britain are sick of working hard to buy vehicles, only to have them stolen by criminals who do not care. The impact of their crimes affect thousands of people, who suffer untold hardship, financial loss & emotional distress due to crime. The law needs to be a major deterrent.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently the penalty for stealing a vehicle does not fit the crime, many criminals walk free from court with punitive punishments, despite causing huge problems for the victims of their crime.

The law needs to ensure that theft of a vehicle is so harshly punished it will make it unappealing.

attributes.action: Consolidate mobile telephone infrastructure networks under one umbrella company
attributes.background: Many of us consumers choose a mobile provider based on coverage in the areas where we live and work. But when we travel we often find connectivity is poor (or non-existent) in certain areas if we are customers of the wrong provider.
attributes.additional_details: If the network infrastructure were to become owned by one umbrella company, then we could have excellent coverage no matter with which provider we were customers. The providers would then have a similar business relationship with the umbrella company as train operators have with Network Rail, or broadband providers have with BT Openreach. In attracting customers, providers could no longer rely on coverage, but would need to find innovative ways to be competitive.

attributes.action: Where possible, make it policy for cars used by all authorities, be British made
attributes.background: It only seems logical for cars used by the police force, or even any other public body, buy cars with the vast majority of their supply chain in Britain - as long as the car serves that particular purpose and is cost effective. Not only does it decrease a carbon footprint, it safeguards an industry.

attributes.action: Create more opportunities to further vocational subject skills in state schools.
attributes.background: In state education here in the U.K our youth have next to no chances to properly further their vocational skills, e.g dance! Many schools not offering a thing in some of these areas that could potentially be the child's gift in life! For many school is the only outlet for them to progress in this.
attributes.additional_details: Focus on sporting and academic departments take away sometimes completely from the vocational or artistic side. If that is a career a youth would want to pursue then it is the EDUCATION systems duty to EDUCATE the students on such matters! But no input or teaching on these skills are taught, hindering the abilities of our youths and holding them back from their potential, MANY, MANY people have a skill in vocational activities and subjects that could lead to a career in it.

attributes.action: Solution to restrict migration, whilst appeasing freedom of movement
attributes.background: All solutions on this issue will not please everyone, so neutral ground must be found. This I believe is a good solution to restrict the number of incoming EU nationals while maintaining freedom of movement to those who genuinely want to live & work in the UK, which in turn allows free trade with EU
attributes.additional_details:
•	All EU arrivals to the UK must complete 24 months of paid contributions to the state before receiving free NHS care 
•	Prior to completing the 24 months, all those who do not qualify for free state medical care must have a private European style health insurance policy
•	All foreign nationals wishing to transfer money overseas must pay a government stamp duty or tax
•	EU nationals claiming benefits, a maximum of 20% of income into the account is allowed to be transferred outside of the UK

attributes.action: Change the Student Loan to allow Student Exchange Programs
attributes.background: The Government should allow the student loan scheme to include loans for Student/Foreign Exchange Programs for those wanting to go beyond the European grant of study grant which maybe abolished after Brexit which means the Government must inclue a scheme/loan for Student/Foreign Exchange Program.
